body: Billows the fog, cloaksLike theirs ends? From what distant point of visionThat desire has ever built, have approachedChoces, Mère and Père, undreaming even of fieldstheir bellies, they're out cold, instantaneouslyThe weight of being born into exile is lifted.Like an old soldier, wakeful, in his tent!Archangel Winter, darkness on his backEscapees from the cold work of living,marked with a dark stroke from the left, encroachedUpon from the right by far trees, that white placeAs distant memories, through the fog-dimmed light,Sits at the limit of a kind of worldNever does any motion, sound, or lightSo you can watch me watch uplifted snowDown the road, at Cypress Gardens, a womanReshaping magnified, each risen flakeXIV. Franz Josef Land: The Amazing Drift of the TegetthoffI know,
